groundTruth.text: The 2019-2020 global pandemic has been caused by a disease called coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). This disease has been caused by the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2). By April 30 2020, the World Health Organization reported 3,096,626 cases and 217,896 deaths, which implies an exponential growth for infection and deaths worldwide. Currently, there are various computer-based approaches that present COVID-19 data through different types of charts, which is very useful to recognise its behavior and trends. Nevertheless, such approaches do not allow for observation of any projection regarding confirmed cases and deaths, which would be useful to understand the trends of COVID-19. In this work, we have designed and developed an online dashboard that presents actual information about COVID-19. Furthermore, based on this information, we have designed a mathematical model in order to make projections about the evolution of cases and deaths worldwide and by country.

problem.title: Predictive Modeling for Dynamic Disease Spread and Impact Projection
problem.description: The challenge of developing robust, real-time predictive models to project the spread and impact of infectious diseases such as COVID-19 (e.g., case counts, fatalities) at global and regional scales. This requires integrating heterogeneous data sources, accounting for uncertainty, and enabling actionable insights for public health decision-making beyond static descriptive analytics.

templateData.title: Technical Framework for Predictive Modeling of Dynamic Disease Spread and Impact Projection
templateData.description: A structured template capturing technical implementation details for real-time predictive modeling of infectious disease spread, integrating heterogeneous data sources, uncertainty quantification, and actionable public health insights. Emphasizes methodological rigor, quantitative evaluation, and cross-domain adaptability for computational epidemiology and computational social science applications.

templateProperty.label: Core Model Architecture
templateProperty.description: Named predictive model or hybrid architecture employed (e.g., SEIR variants, agent-based models, neural differential equations, or ensemble methods). Specify if custom or adapted from existing frameworks.

templateProperty.label: Heterogeneous Data Integration Strategy
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for merging disparate data sources (e.g., ETL pipelines, federated learning, knowledge graphs, or probabilistic data fusion). Include handling of temporal misalignment, missingness, and semantic heterogeneity.

templateProperty.label: Primary Datasets
templateProperty.description: Named datasets used as model inputs (e.g., JHU CSSE COVID-19 Data, GISAID, mobility data from SafeGraph, or regional health records). List all critical datasets with versions if applicable.

templateProperty.label: Uncertainty Quantification Method
templateProperty.description: Technical method for estimating and propagating uncertainty (e.g., Bayesian inference, Monte Carlo dropout, probabilistic programming, or interval predictions). Specify if aleatoric vs. epistemic uncertainty is distinguished.

templateProperty.label: Real-Time Processing Framework
templateProperty.description: Named framework or custom stack for streaming data ingestion and model updates (e.g., Apache Spark, Flink, Kafka Streams, or edge computing solutions). Include latency constraints if applicable.

templateProperty.label: Spatiotemporal Resolution
templateProperty.description: Granularity of predictions in space (e.g., country, region, county, grid cell) and time (e.g., daily, weekly, hourly). Specify if adaptive resolution is used.

templateProperty.label: Primary Evaluation Metrics
templateProperty.description: Quantitative metrics used to validate model performance (e.g., RMSE, MAE, R for case counts; AUC-ROC, F1 for binary outcomes; or custom epidemiological metrics like attack rate error).

templateProperty.label: RMSE (Case Counts, Log Scale)
templateProperty.description: Root Mean Squared Error for predicted vs. observed case counts on a log scale, aggregated over the evaluation period. Report as a single number or range (e.g., 0.81.2).

templateProperty.label: Maximum Forecast Horizon
templateProperty.description: Farthest time point (in days) for which the model generates reliable predictions. Specify if horizon is dynamic or fixed.

templateProperty.label: Computational Complexity
templateProperty.description: Time/space complexity of the model (e.g., O(n) for matrix operations) or empirical runtime for training/inference on specified hardware (e.g., '12 hours on 8x A100 GPUs for global 30-day forecast').

templateProperty.label: Intervention Modeling Approach
templateProperty.description: Technical method for incorporating non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) or vaccines (e.g., time-varying parameters, counterfactual simulations, or reinforcement learning for policy optimization).

templateProperty.label: Benchmark Datasets for Validation
templateProperty.description: Named datasets used for comparative evaluation (e.g., COVID-19 Forecast Hub, FluSight, or synthetic benchmarks). Include version or time range if applicable.

templateProperty.label: Model Calibration Method
templateProperty.description: Technique for fitting model parameters to data (e.g., MCMC, variational inference, or gradient-based optimization). Specify if automated or manual tuning is used.

templateProperty.label: Primary Data Collection Period
templateProperty.description: Time range (startend dates) for the primary dataset used in model training/evaluation. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).

templateProperty.label: Source Code Repository
templateProperty.description: Publicly accessible URL to the implementation code (e.g., GitHub, GitLab, or institutional repository). Include specific commit hash if applicable.

templateProperty.label: Hardware Requirements
templateProperty.description: Specifications for minimal/optimal hardware to run the model (e.g., '4x NVIDIA V100 GPUs, 128GB RAM' or 'CPU-only with 16GB RAM for regional models').

templateProperty.label: External Validity Testing
templateProperty.description: Description of methods used to test generalizability (e.g., cross-regional validation, temporal holdout, or synthetic data augmentation). Specify if transfer learning is employed.

templateProperty.label: Ethical AI and Bias Mitigation
templateProperty.description: Technical measures to address bias, fairness, or ethical risks (e.g., demographic stratification of error rates, differential privacy, or algorithmic impact assessments). Reference frameworks if applicable (e.g., 'WHO Ethics Guidelines for AI in Health').

templateProperty.label: Publication DOI
templateProperty.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the primary research paper or preprint describing the model. Use full DOI URL (e.g., 'https://doi.org/10.1038/...').

templateProperty.label: Adaptive Learning Mechanism
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for model updates in response to new data or concept drift (e.g., online learning, continual learning, or periodic retraining). Specify trigger conditions if applicable.

templateProperty.label: Visualization Tools
templateProperty.description: Named tools or libraries used for generating actionable insights (e.g., Dash, Plotly, Kepler.gl, or custom WebGL-based dashboards).

overall.comments: very good usability and also from the research contribution.
Very good. This may need some improvement related to domain knowledge but overall it is very good.
